Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Ultrafiltration membranes with dense skin layer and finger-hole-like support layer

Other Information.Additional Info: Removal efficiency depends on both sieving effect and catalytic degradation by reactive oxygen species.

Sieving Mechanism: Synergistic effect between size sieving of membrane surface pores and catalytic degradation of PMS

Experimental Validation.Method: Cross-flow filtration experiments, EPR analysis, quenching experiments
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: TC removal rate: 90.36% after 1 hour at optimal conditions

Other Information.Additional Info: The system can maintain high activation effect of PMS in a wide pH range of 3–11, with a removal rate above 80% at 60 min.
